alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 3:53PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 PM MST, a gauge report at the New River Dam Outlet indicated water levels have risen to over 1000 cfs due to excessive runoff from heavy rains earlier today. This amount of water flow will likely overtop Jomax Road. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Phoenix. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
